title: 4 Easy Ways to Enter the BIOS on a Lenovo Laptop

steps.title: Reboot or turn on the computer.
steps.content: Reboot or turn on the computer. As soon as the computer restarts, you’ll see a black screen that says ″lenovo″ in large white letters. [1] X Research source The screen only appears for a few seconds, so you’ll need to perform the next step quickly. If you’re using Windows 8/8.1, you’ll need to restart the computer from Windows to access the BIOS. From the Windows desktop, press ⊞ Win + i , click Power , and then click Restart .

steps.title: Repeatedly tap F2 until the BIOS appears.
steps.content: Repeatedly tap F2 until the BIOS appears. Aim to press the key twice per second. The key you need to use for your model appears at the bottom of the ″lenovo″ screen next to ″to Setup.″ [2] X Research source You may need to press FN + F2 . Other models and Linux computers use F1 instead of F2 . [3] X Research source This may take a few attempts until you can enter BIOS.

steps.title: Shut down your laptop or computer.
steps.content: Shut down your laptop or computer. Go to the Start menu and click Power > Shut Down .

steps.title: Press the One Key Recovery (Novo) button.
steps.content: Press the One Key Recovery (Novo) button. This button usually looks like a curved arrow pointing backward and is usually on the top or side of your device. [4] X Research source Only Ideapad Lenovo's have the Novo button. [5] X Research source Your computer will boot directly into BIOS when you press this button.

steps.title: Click the Start menu.
steps.content: Click the Start menu. It’s usually at the bottom-left corner of the desktop. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings .
steps.content: Click Settings . It’s near the bottom of the menu. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Update & security.
steps.content: Click Update & security . It’s the option with a curved arrow.

steps.title: Click Recovery.
steps.content: Click Recovery . It’s in the left column. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Restart now.
steps.content: Click Restart now . It’s under ″Advanced startup″ in the right panel. The PC will reboot to a blue menu.

steps.title: Click Troubleshoot on the menu.
steps.content: Click Troubleshoot on the menu. It’s the option with a screwdriver and a wrench. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click Advanced options.
steps.content: Click Advanced options . It’s the last option.

steps.title: Click UEFI Firmware Settings.
steps.content: Click UEFI Firmware Settings . It’s in the right column. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Click Restart.
steps.content: Click Restart . The PC will restart and boot into the BIOS.

steps.title: Log out of Windows.
steps.content: Log out of Windows. Windows 10: Click Start . Click your user name. It’s at the top-left corner of the menu. Click Sign out . Windows 8.1/8: Press ⊞ Win + X . Click Shut down or sign out . It’s at the bottom of the menu. Click Sign out .

steps.title: Hold ⇧ Shift as you click the menu.
steps.content: Hold ⇧ Shift as you click the menu. Don’t lift your finger when the menu appears.

steps.title: Continue holding ⇧ Shift and click Restart.
steps.content: Continue holding ⇧ Shift and click Restart . Keep holding the key down as the PC reboots to a blue menu screen. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Click Troubleshoot on the menu.
steps.content: Click Troubleshoot on the menu. It’s the option with a screwdriver and a wrench. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Click Advanced options.
steps.content: Click Advanced options . It’s the last option. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Click UEFI Firmware Settings.
steps.content: Click UEFI Firmware Settings . It’s in the right column. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Click Restart.
steps.content: Click Restart . The PC will restart and boot into the BIOS. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Move the mouse to the top-right corner of the home screen and then move it downward.
steps.content: Move the mouse to the top-right corner of the home screen and then move it downward. A menu will appear. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings .

steps.title: Click Change PC Settings.
steps.content: Click Change PC Settings . It’s at the bottom of the menu. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Click Update and recovery.
steps.content: Click Update and recovery . It’s at the bottom of the left column.

steps.title: Click Recovery.
steps.content: Click Recovery . It’s in the left column.

steps.title: Click Restart now.
steps.content: Click Restart now . It’s under the ″Advanced startup″ header in the right panel. The PC will reboot to a blue menu.

steps.title: Click Troubleshoot on the menu.
steps.content: Click Troubleshoot on the menu. It’s the option with a screwdriver and a wrench.

steps.title: Click Advanced options.
steps.content: Click Advanced options . It’s the last option.

steps.title: Click UEFI Firmware Settings.
steps.content: Click UEFI Firmware Settings . It’s in the right column.

steps.title: Click Restart.
steps.content: Click Restart . The PC will restart and boot into the BIOS.
